title: Whirlpool Assessment
description: This assessment will help you map your current whirlpool state across all layers of wellbeing.
instructions: For each statement, indicate how true it is for you on a scale from 1 (Not at all true) to 5 (Very true).

sections.title: Spiritual Connection
sections.description: Your connection to meaning, purpose, and something larger than yourself.

sections.title: Energy Flow
sections.description: Your vital life force and how it's maintained and expressed.

sections.title: Biological Foundations
sections.description: The fundamental physical practices that support your whirlpool's energy flow.

sections.title: Mental Landscape
sections.description: Your thought patterns, self-relationship, and cognitive flexibility.

sections.title: Reflective Functioning
sections.description: Your ability to understand your own and others' mental states, emotions, and behaviors.

sections.title: Relationship Patterns
sections.description: Your patterns of connection, communication, and security in close relationships.

questions.text: I have a clear sense of meaning and purpose in my life
I feel connected to something larger than myself
I live according to my core values
I have sufficient energy for the activities that matter to me
I engage in activities that energize and revitalize me
I can identify what drains my energy and manage it effectively
I engage in intentional physical activity (exercise, walking, movement practices) for at least 30 minutes most days
I incorporate different types of movement in my routine (strength, cardiovascular, flexibility)
I genuinely enjoy the forms of movement I engage in rather than viewing them as obligations
I eat a variety of whole, unprocessed foods (vegetables, fruits, proteins, healthy fats) most days
I have a positive relationship with food, eating mindfully and without guilt
I notice how different foods affect my energy, mood, and mental clarity
I consistently get 7-9 hours of quality sleep most nights
I maintain regular sleep and wake times that align with my natural rhythms
I have effective practices for rest and recovery when feeling depleted (beyond sleep)
I recognize the connection between my physical practices and my emotional wellbeing
I can recognize and work with difficult thoughts and emotions
I have a generally positive relationship with myself
I can adapt my thinking when faced with new situations
I can identify and name my emotions as they arise
I understand how my thoughts and feelings influence my behavior
I can recognize when others' perspectives differ from my own
I'm able to consider what might be happening in another person's mind
I find it relatively easy to get close to others
I can communicate my needs clearly in close relationships
I trust that important people in my life will be there when I need them
I can maintain a sense of self-worth even during relationship difficulties
